intro: Melilotus glaucescens, commonly known as blue melilot, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in dense spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Blue melilot is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
